title: [Large-Scale] Instructional Design Based on Transfer Learning and Multi-Task Learning for Autonomous Optical Network Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of neural network fundamentals, basic reinforcement learning concepts, and fundamental optical network structures
context.additional_context: Learners participate in practical exercises via personal devices and are evaluated on their ability to apply real network scenarios through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Cultivating the ability to design knowledge transfer between various network state data using transfer learning techniques.
Developing an agent that simultaneously processes routing, modulation, spectrum allocation (RMSA), and anycast service tasks through multi-task learning.
Implementing a processing structure for common state data and task-specific state data through modular DRL agent design.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
